channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 10th September
item.description:
This vehicle has been parked in my road for months with no one going near it in all that time so must be dumped!!! Reg number AR19 FMJ White Transit Van

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnes Cray Road, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dying cherry tree, 10th September
item.description:
Tree is dying and bits dropping on parked cars, on the pavement and into the road. Tree has been there over 40 years

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gatling Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: St George’s flag painted on coop and more bloody intimidatory flags, 10th September
item.description:
This is not Belfast. Why are you letting these fascists intimidate your population?

item.title: Big Union Jack outside school, 10th September
item.description:
A huge Union Jack has now been placed outside Bedonwell School. Bexley Council may not think it is a problem, but it is part of a concerted campaign led by Far Right activist Tommy Robinson to intimidate minorities and we don't want this sort of thing outside schools acting as some sort of territorial marker for the Far Right. It is unacceptable and Bexley coucil need to rethink their policy as it is getting out of hand.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedonwell Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large flags hung from street lights, 10th September
item.description:
Multiple large flags hung from street lights along shop parade as part of campaign widely associated with hate speech and the far right. Intimidating to customers and harming local small businesses.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, The Oval, Blackfen, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Millard close car park, 10th September
item.description:
Car park is heavily flooded with water or what smells like sewage. Cannot walk through it to get to vehicles parked. Sewage smell seems to be coming up from the drains in my kitchen and when windows are opened

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Millard Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gas works, 10th September
item.description:
Effort should be made to fix this issue urgently. Causing serious congestion to lupus street, rampayne street, Vauxhall bridge road. All made worse by tube strike. This road is continually bring dug up. Is it incompetence?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lupus Street, Pimlico, London

item.title: Car is sorn but is still on the road for months, 10th September
item.description:
This car has been sorn for over a year. The council did put a notice on that they would remove it. It was taken off the road over night and put back with new number plates. Now all the residents have purchased resident permits how is this car still on the road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sampson Close, West Heath, London

item.title: Junction of Charteris and Hazelmere roads, 10th September
item.description:
2ft by 1ft (at the moment) hole in road where brick surface has sunk. Already bigger than when first noticed 20 mins ago. Hope it isn’t a sinkhole. The cause is definitely under the road surface and is a hazard to pedestrians and motorists. Needs immediate coning off.

Report on FixMyStreet
